author: John Cheng, Hoi Yuet Woo
description: A seasonal lift for Asian equities in July may falter this year as tariff and macroeconomic concerns dampen sentiment.
title: Asia’s Strong July Track Record to Be Put to Test by Tariff Risk

author: Derek Wallbank
description: President Donald Trump said Israel has agreed to the conditions needed for a 60-day ceasefire in Gaza, adding that the plan would now be presented to Hamas.
title: Trump Says Israel Agreed to Terms for 60-Day Gaza Ceasefire

author: Alex Vasquez
description: Mexico’s lower house approved the general text of a watered-down bill to overhaul telecommunications regulations, after the proposal’s initial draft provoked objections that the government was seeking to censor critical media.
title: Mexico Congress Backs Bill to Overhaul Telecoms Regulations

author: Michael D McDonald
description: A Costa Rican court voted to revoke President Rodrigo Chaves’s immunity in a case of alleged influence peddling.
title: Costa Rica Court Votes to Revoke Presidential Immunity

author: Yang Yang, Naomi Ng, K Oanh Ha
description: Today on the Big Take Asia podcast: US companies are grappling with tariff challenges on their Chinese supply chains. How one toymaker is fighting back.
title: The American Toymaker Suing Trump Over Destructive Tariffs

author: Chris Strohm
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation plans to move its headquarters to the Ronald Reagan Building complex in Washington, scuttling Biden administration plans approved by Congress to move the agency to the Maryland suburbs.
title: FBI to Keep Headquarters in Washington as Lawmakers Protest

author: Alicia Diaz, Cam Kettles, Erik Wasson
description: Donald Trump’s multitrillion-dollar tax bill is running into Republican resistance in the House as moderate and ultra-conservative GOP lawmakers threaten to defy the president and sink his domestic agenda.
title: Trump Tax Bill Hits Republican Resistance in House Ahead of Vote

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, politics and health care reporter Rachel Cohrs Zhang analyzes the ramifications of what President Donald Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill will do to Medicaid and its recipients. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Tax Bill Progresses, But GOP Disquiet Over Medicaid Persists

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump said he is not considering delaying his July 9 deadline for higher tariffs to resume and renewed his threat to cut off talks and impose duty rates on several nations, including Japan.
title: Trump Sticks With July 9 Tariff Deadline While Hitting Japan

author: Alicia Diaz, Mackenzie Hawkins
description: Sweeping tax legislation passed by the Senate Tuesday would make it cheaper for semiconductor manufacturers to build plants in the US, delivering a win to chipmakers and boosting US efforts to expand the industry domestically.
title: Chipmakers Win Bigger Tax Credit Under Bill Passed by Senate

author: Samy Adghirni
description: France’s minority government on Tuesday survived a no-confidence motion over the pension reform thanks to Marine Le Pen’s far-right party abstaining in the vote.
title: French Premier Survives No-Confidence Vote as Far Right Abstains

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Samy Adghirni
description: French President Emmanuel Macron has reached out to Volodomyr Zelenskiy to brief him about his phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Macron Briefed Zelenskiy on His Call With Putin, People Say

author: Amanda Albright
description: The municipal-bond market is poised to go to infinity — and beyond — with a new financing tool included in President Donald Trump’s tax and spending bill that passed the Senate Tuesday.
title: Muni Market Poised for ‘Space Bonds’ With New Senate Tax Bill

author: Alicia Diaz
description: President Donald Trump’s multitrillion-dollar tax and spending package moved closer to reality after it passed the Senate Tuesday.
title: What’s in the Trump Tax Bill That Just Passed the Senate

author: Cassandre Coyer
description: Twenty state attorneys general are seeking to block the Trump administration from sharing personal health data with the Department of Homeland Security for immigration enforcement in a lawsuit to be filed Tuesday.
title: Trump Accused by 20 States of Sharing Medicaid Data With ICE

author: Ekow Dontoh
description: Ghana plans to ask India for support to develop a vaccine hub when Prime Minister Narendra Modi visits the West African nation this week.
title: Ghana to Seek India’s Backing for Vaccine Hub as Modi Visits

author: Lucy White, Ailbhe Rea, Joe Mayes
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer gave away the last of the savings from his signature welfare overhaul to avoid a damaging rebellion that threatened to inflict a historic defeat on his government.
title: Starmer Drops Bulk of Welfare Reforms to Avert Labour Revolt

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The US Senate handed President Donald Trump a major political victory with its Tuesday passage of a sweeping domestic policy bill, bringing him one step closer to a signature legislative achievement in an administration that has largely governed through executive power.
title: Trump Risks Voter Blowback as ‘One Big Beautiful Bill’ Moves Forward

author: Eric Martin
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio issued a fresh broadside against USAID on the agency’s last day of existence, defending the Trump administration’s move to deny funding to programs that proponents argue have saved millions of lives.
title: Rubio Unleashes Fresh Broadside Against USAID on Its Final Day

author: Konrad Krasuski
description: Poland’s Supreme Court validated the victory of the opposition candidate Karol Nawrocki in last month’s presidential election amid controversy about voting irregularities.
title: Polish Supreme Court Validates Nawrocki’s Presidential Victory

author: Josh Saul, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Shares for solar companies rose on Tuesday on the Senate’s decision to remove an excise tax on wind and solar projects from President Donald Trump’s tax and spending bill.
title: Solar Firms Surge as Senate Drops Excise Tax From Trump Bill

author: Elizabeth Rembert
description: Columbia University received a warning that its accreditation may be “in jeopardy” from the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, which cited “insufficient evidence” that the school is in compliance with certain standards like fostering a respectful campus climate.
title: Columbia Receives Warning That Its Accreditation Is at Risk

author: Erik Larson
description: The US Justice Department told a skeptical judge that the government won’t apply President Donald Trump’s executive order on birthright citizenship to affected immigrants before July 27, when the US Supreme Court’s 30-day pause on the directive expires.
title: US Gives Birthright Case Judge Assurances Amid Deportation Fears

author: Samy Adghirni, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: French President Emmanuel Macron and Vladimir Putin agreed to coordinate their approach on Iran in their first phone call since 2022, marking a rare overture from a European head to the Russian leader.
title: Macron Opens Iran Talks With Putin in First Call Since 2022

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis, Emily Birnbaum
description: Donald Trump’s $3.3 trillion tax and spending cut bill passed the Senate Tuesday after a furious push by Republican leaders to persuade holdouts to back the legislation and hand the president a political win.
title: Trump’s Tax Bill Passes US Senate as Republicans Notch Major Win

author: Laura Nahmias, Gregory Korte
description: Andrew Cuomo is weighing his next move after democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani clinched the Democratic nomination for mayor of New York City by a staggering 12-point margin over the former governor.
title: Cuomo Weighs Next Steps as Mamdani Scores Big Win in NYC Primary

author: Brian K Sullivan, Lou Del Bello
description: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration is proposing cutting about 18% of its workforce and slashing $1.5 billion from its budget, including terminating programs to protect coastal communities and research that supports better forecasts and natural disaster prediction.
title: NOAA Budget Cuts to Gut Climate Research, Slash Jobs

author: Julian Lee
description: Lower exports from smaller ports offset increased flows from two key terminals
title: Russia's Crude Oil Shipments Stick Close to a Two-Month Low

author: Kira Zavyalova
description: President Vladimir Putin signed a decree in an attempt to attract new foreign investment into Russia’s financial markets, despite sweeping sanctions over the war in Ukraine.
title: Putin Offers Special Account to Lure New Investors to Russia

author: Erik Wasson, Emily Birnbaum, Steven T. Dennis
description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune said his chamber will soon vote on passage of President Donald Trump’s tax and spending bill after securing enough support to pass the legislation.
title: Senators to Vote on Trump’s Tax Bill After Deal, Thune Says

author: Martha Viotti Beck, Simone Iglesias, Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva picked a fight with Congress over taxation of the rich, offering an early glimpse of political and economic debates that are set to rage through the country’s presidential election next year.
title: Lula Fights to Tax the Rich in Preview of 2026 Election Battle

author: Michael Smith, Sophie Alexander, Rachel Adams-Heard
description: On June 20, nearly three weeks into the Atlantic hurricane season, Florida disaster-management officials assembled a group of emergency relief contractors in Tallahassee and asked them to do something they had never done before.
title: Florida Taps Contractors With No Detention Experience for ‘Alligator Alcatraz’

author: Henry Meyer
description: A Russian court sentenced a former deputy defense minister to 13 years in prison on embezzlement charges, the Tass news service reported, the highest ranking military official to be convicted since President Vladimir Putin appointed a new head of the Defense Ministry last year.
title: Russia Hands Ex-Deputy Defense Minister 13 Years for Graft

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: Iran is said to be cutting off communication with key United Nations watchdog officials, deepening uncertainty over the status of its nuclear program and introducing additional ambiguity to the diplomatic showdown with Washington.
title: Iran Shuts Out Nuclear Monitors in Tactics Echoing Cold War

author: Jasmine Ng
description: Donald Trump threatened to withdraw government subsidies from Elon Musk’s companies and examine the billionaire’s immigration status after the Tesla Inc. chief executive officer ratcheted up his criticism of the president’s tax and spending bill.
title: Trump-Musk Battle Restarts After Billionaire Bashes Tax Bill

author: Ugur Yilmaz
description: Turkey detained four employees of a satirical magazine including a cartoonist accused of depicting the Prophet Muhammad, as the government intensifies its crackdown on dissent.
title: Turkey Cracks Down on Magazine Over Alleged Prophet Cartoon

author: Alan Crawford, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: After more than three years of all-out war with Russia, the country has turned into a factory of weaponry that’s redefining the battlefield.
title: The Future of Modern Warfare Is Being Built in Ukraine

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Deep cuts to the US Agency for International Development and its potential dismantling under President Donald Trump could result in about 14 million additional deaths by 2030, according to a study released in a prominent medical journal.
title: Study Warns Trump’s Plan for US Aid Cuts Risks 14 Million Additional Deaths

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: China has sanctioned former Philippine Senator Francis Tolentino, prohibiting him from entering mainland China, Hong Kong and Macau, in a rare move as tensions with Manila rise.
title: China Sanctions Former Philippine Senator as Tensions Swell

author: Lucille Liu
description: China’s manufacturing activity rebounded in June, according to a private survey, suggesting relief after a trade-war truce with the US.
title: China’s Private Factory Reading Rebounds After Trump Trade Truce

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra revamped her cabinet, a move aimed at easing a political crisis that brought her government to the brink over her handling of a border dispute.
title: Thai PM Reshuffles Cabinet in Bid to Steady Wobbly Government
